alert.note: Alert for Wirt; Wood (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 8:07PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Wirt and southern Wood Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 806 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lubeck, or 7 miles southwest of Belpre, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm. Locations impacted include... Parkersburg, Belpre, Lubeck, Washington, Mineralwells, Belleville, Blennerhassett, Davisville, Greencastle, Morristown, Rockport and Freeport. This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 157 and 174. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 6. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to travel across flooded roads. Find alternate routes. It takes only a few inches of swiftly flowing water to carry vehicles away. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground.
